by tea party activists and others- have pledged to reverse this dangerous trend of wasteful federal spending in an effort to place the nation on the path toward fiscal sanity. Veteran Indiana Congressman Mike Pence said: Any increase in the debt ceiling should be married to very real and significant reductions in spending in the short term and the long term. In light of this, one must ask, what will it take to persuade Congress and the Obama administration to reverse the trend of outrageous extravagance? The importance of this issue can not be

signal of his political plans. "This nation faces serious challenges that will require us to renew our commitment to the institutions that are resilient enough to lead America back," Mike Pence said. I believe those are, the institutions are, and have always been, faith, family, community and state government. To renew our nation we must have a renewal of American federalism. Mike Pence met earlier in the day with officials including Republican Gov. Mitch Daniels , who can't run for third term and also is considering whether to enter the 2012 presidential campaign.
